intro: Ribes acidum, commonly known as the gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It produces small, tart berries that are typically green or yellow when unripe and turn red or orange when mature. The plant belongs to the family Grossulariaceae and is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers.
